title: Nanofiber applications in microbial fuel cells for enhanced energy generation: a mini review
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,9122-9136
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA00674G, Review Article
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Fatma Yalcinkaya, Rafael Torres-Mendieta, Jakub Hruza, Andrea Vávrová, Lucie Svobodová, Andrea Pietrelli, Ioannis Ieropoulos
Microbial fuel cells (MFCs) represent simple devices that harness the metabolic activities of microorganisms to produce electrical energy from diverse sources such as organic waste and sustainable biomass.
